article_text: Moran was one of only 11 Republican senators who teamed up with tea party favorite Ted Cruz to try to defeat the omnibus spending bill, which put him at odds with GOP leadership. Moran’s move raised eyebrows because he’d spent the past two years as part of that leadership team. So why did Moran buck the party line? Maybe it’s because he’s up for re-election in 2016.

article_metadata.title: Will Sen. Jerry Moran of Kansas jump from GOP leadership to the ‘Cruz caucus’? | The Kansas City Star

article_summary:
Moran’s move raised eyebrows because he’d spent the past two years as part of that leadership team.
Moran was one of only 11 Republican senators who teamed up with tea party favorite Ted Cruz to try to defeat the omnibus spending bill, which put him at odds with GOP leadership.
So why did Moran buck the party line?
Maybe it’s because he’s up for re-election in 2016.
